skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: ArtemisAI

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown guideline files for writing internal communications. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities are present. The skill provides formatting instructions and prompt templates only.

content.value_statement: Writing internal communications takes time and requires consistent formatting. This skill provides structured templates and guidelines for 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, and more. Use this skill to quickly create professional internal communications that match your company standards.
actual_capabilities: Write Progress, Plans, Problems (3P) team updates
Create company-wide newsletters with structured sections
Generate FAQ responses for common employee questions
Draft general internal communications with custom formats
Apply consistent company communication style and tone
limitations: Does not access Slack, Email, or Calendar tools automatically
Requires user to provide communication content and context
Does not generate metrics or data - only formats provided information
Templates follow company-specific formats but need customization

use_cases.title: Weekly Team Updates
use_cases.description: Create concise 3P updates that executives can read in under a minute

use_cases.title: Company Newsletters
use_cases.description: Draft structured company-wide newsletters with categorized sections and links

use_cases.title: FAQ Documentation
use_cases.description: Address common employee questions with clear, consistent answers

prompt_templates.title: 3P Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for [Team Name] covering [Date Range]. Include Progress (what was accomplished), Plans (what is planned), and Problems (any blockers). Keep each section to 1-3 sentences.

prompt_templates.title: Company Newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter with sections for Announcements, Progress on Priorities, Leadership Updates, and Social Updates. Each bullet should be 1-2 sentences with relevant links.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ Response
prompt_templates.prompt: Answer this frequently asked question: [Question]. Provide a clear 1-2 sentence answer with a link to official documentation if available.

prompt_templates.title: General Communication
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an internal communication for [Audience] about [Topic]. The purpose is [Purpose]. Use a [formal/casual/urgent] tone. Keep it clear and concise.

output_examples.input: Write a 3P update for the Engineering team covering last week
output: Progress: Shipped 3 features including the new authentication system. Closed 12 user-reported bugs. Onboarded 2 new engineers.
Plans: Focus on performance optimization for the API. Begin Q2 planning process. Continue security audit remediation.
Problems: API latency issues require immediate attention. Need 2 additional backend engineers for Q2 roadmap.

best_practices: Gather context from stakeholders before drafting communications
Keep 3P updates under 60 seconds to read with data-driven content
Include relevant links in newsletters for employees who want more detail
anti_patterns: Including detailed team information in company-wide newsletters
Writing 3P updates without specific metrics or accomplishments
Using casual language in formal leadership communications

faq.question: Does this skill connect to my company tools?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides templates and formatting guidelines. You provide the content from your own knowledge or tools.

faq.question: Can I customize the output formats?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit the example files in the examples/ folder to match your company communication standards.

faq.question: What communication types are supported?
faq.answer: 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQ responses, status reports, leadership updates, project updates, and incident reports.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs entirely locally with no network calls or data storage. Your communications stay private.

faq.question: How long should a 3P update be?
faq.answer: Keep each section (Progress, Plans, Problems) to 1-3 sentences. The entire update should be readable in 30-60 seconds.

faq.question: How is this different from general writing skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on internal company formats and structures. It ensures consistent formatting across all organizational communications.
